title: Middle leaders as catalysts for improving teacher practice: developing a knowledge exchange and impact network with Challenge Partners' schools
abstractText:
This applied research project represents a partnership between Challenge Partners and the London Centre for Leadership in Learning, Institute of Education. The aim of the project is to collaborate with a group of influential middle leaders, supporting them to:

  • discover and then share knowledge across their schools about excellent middle leadership practice that has an impact
  • develop effective ways to share this knowledge with their Challenge Partner colleagues, and middle leaders beyond their immediate network
  • co-develop evidence-based tools to track ways in which they change and enhance their own and teachersâ€™ practice as a result of this knowledge exchange
  • find ways to promote sustainable norms of between-school knowledge exchange.

Our approach will be to use workshops and intersessional activity to support the participants in: 

  • exchanging research and practitioner knowledge
  • using this knowledge to develop tools that can enhance both their practice and the practice of colleagues.

Methods to evaluate the impact of our approach include reviewing literature, telephone interviews and observation analysis.
